instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2879: What is 820-2879? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.
definitions.CHGR_ACOK: What is CHGR_ACOK? This is identical to SMC_BC_ACOK. This will come out of the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging chip when CHGR_ACIN & CHGR_DCIN are present, and is necessary for the onewire circuit to begin working. On most Macbooks, CHGR_ACOK needs to be present in order for PP3V42_G3H to flow to the onewire circuit so that the circuitry that allows the charger to communicate with the SMC will turn on.  .
definitions.R7021: What is R7021? Current sense resistor between charger current sense shunt resistor and ISL6259. When these resistors fail the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being drawn from the charger, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing power from the charger as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H around 4v, quarter fan spin, or battery not charging..
definitions.R5280: What is R5280? Pullup resistor between PP3V42_G3H and SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SDA which is a data line that allows the SMC to communicate with the battery and the battery charging chip. This line is necessary for the battery to be recognized. With red probe on ground, diode mode should measure 0.441 on pin 2 of this resistor. .
definitions.R7022: What is R7022? Current sense resistor between charger current sense shunt resistor and ISL6259. When these resistors fail the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being drawn from the charger, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing power from the charger as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H around 4v, quarter fan spin, or battery not charging..
definitions.R5281: What is R5281? Pullup resistor between PP3V42_G3H and SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SCL which is a data line that allows the SMC to communicate with the battery and the battery charging chip. This line is necessary for the battery to be recognized. With red probe on ground, diode mode should measure 0.441 on pin 2 of this resistor. .
definitions.R7020: What is R7020? Current sense shunt resistor for the charger, the resistors between this and the ISL6259 should be proper rating or else machine will turn off the charger. Measuring pins 27/28 on ISL6259 should give you 20.02 ohms. .

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b powering up from battery but no power from charger
threads.message:
Hi i have here water damaged <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b  want power up from charger but powering up from battery. water went on <TRANSISTOR>Q7030</TRANSISTOR> and <TRANSISTOR>Q7035</TRANSISTOR> so i replace it also i replaced <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> us well this same time.
<RESISTOR>R7021</RESISTOR> : ok
<RESISTOR>R7022</RESISTOR> : ok
<RESISTOR>R7010</RESISTOR> : ok
<RESISTOR>R7011</RESISTOR> : ok
<RESISTOR>R5281</RESISTOR> : 3.4v
<RESISTOR>R5280</RESISTOR> : 3.4v
<CHIP>U7000</CHIP> pin 14  <SIGNAL>CHGR_ACOK</SIGNAL> :3.26v
L7030 0.43v
any help?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b powering up from battery but no power from charger
threads.message: Voltage on pin 2 from <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>??? if it is ok remove F7040 and check if PPBUSG3H comes high....

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b powering up from battery but no power from charger
threads.message: Sense resistor/traces issue I bet. Check resistance between pins 17/18 and 27/28 of <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b powering up from battery but no power from charger
threads.message:
voltage on pin 2 <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> 16.3v ,
resistance <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> pin 17/18 : 3.3ohm
resistance <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> pin 27/28 : 35.68ohm
i also removed F7040 and PPBUSG3H is 0.50 v

threads.message: If resistors are ok some trace is open, so is up to you.... There is not much more...

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b powering up from battery but no power from charger
threads.message: yes resistor are ok so i dont understand why resistance is so high and not sure how to deal with it, never had that kind of problem yet.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b powering up from battery but no power from charger
threads.message:
At this point, this is nothing more than connect the dots. You must figure out which line is broken.

Also,

[QUOTE="speedyaction, post: 13417"]
resistance <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> pin 27/28 : 35.68v [/QUOTE]

Please don't measure resistance in volts, it's hella confusing. :p

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b powering up from battery but no power from charger
threads.message: i was meaning ohm not volts in post above  lol :) i know i done mistake when i read it :)

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b powering up from battery but no power from charger
threads.message: ok fixed. it was broken  track between pin 27 <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> and  <RESISTOR>R7020</RESISTOR> pin 3. now laptop working and charging battery . thanks :)
